topics.title: 00: Assignments
topics.objectives: This area contains the assignment for the semester. This module is 100% CA.

los.title: Assignment
los.objectives: There is one assignment for this module, with an interim submission during the semester.

topics.title: 01: Kotlin Introduction
topics.objectives: Trace the influences on the Kotlin Programming language. Explore the Kotlin syntax, with a focus on variables, types and functions.

los.title: Kotlin Overview
los.objectives: Here we introduce you to the Kotlin Programming Language and explore it in the context of Java. We will also ready Eclipse for using Kotlin.

los.title: Kotlin Syntax (1 of 2)
los.objectives: An overview of Kotlin's syntax, with particular focus on the constructs we covered in Java.

los.title: Kotlin Syntax (2 of 2)
los.objectives: An deeper overview of Kotlin's syntax, with particular focus on collections, classes and functional programming.

los.title: Labs
los.objectives: Labs

los.title: Kotlin Lab-01 Intro
los.objectives: Introduction to Kotlin and the IntelliJ IDEA.

los.title: Kotlin Lab-02 Control Flow
los.objectives: Introduction to Control Flow in Kotlin and also Strings and Null Safety.

los.title: Kotlin Lab-03 Classes + Collections
los.objectives: Introduction to Kotlin Classes and Collections.

topics.title: 02: Activities
topics.objectives: Trace the influences on the Kotlin Programming language. Create and explore a starter Kotlin Android application in detail.

los.title: Android: Anatomy
los.objectives: A first look at the architecture of an Android application.

los.title: Lab-01a Intro
los.objectives: Download and configure Android Studio (if you have your own computer). Generate and run a sample application.

los.title: Lab-01b Activities
los.objectives: Layout the PlacemarkActivity - supporting create/edit of placemarks

topics.title: 03: Adapters
topics.objectives: Look at Kotlin in more depth. Deep dive into some of its features. Extend the app to manage lists of placemarks using the adapter pattern.

los.title: Android: Foundation
los.objectives: A first look at the structure of an Android application a Kotlin activity.

los.title: Android Application Object
los.objectives: This class enables a global application object to be defined, accessible from all activities

los.title: Recycler View + Adapters
los.objectives: Managing lists is facilitated by the RecyclerView + Adapters - 2 key patterns in Android development

los.title: Lab-02 Adapters
los.objectives: Introduce new activity to display a list of placemarks. Support adding to this list.

topics.title: 04: Models
topics.objectives: Examine key Kotlin Idioms. Start comparing simple Java & Kotlin statements. Introduce a more complete model into Placemark.

los.title: Kotlin Idioms
los.objectives: Kotlin Idioms

los.title: Idioms
los.objectives: A tour of the common idioms in Kotlin

los.title: J2K Variables & Expressions
los.objectives: Snippets of the same code in Java & Kotlin

los.title: Toolbar
los.objectives: The Android Support Library implements AppCompatActivity + a range of general purpose components, including a ToolBar

los.title: Memory Store
los.objectives: Abstract the Placemarks data structure into PlacemarkStore interface + in-memory implementation.

los.title: Adapter + Listener
los.objectives: Equip the Adapter with a Listener interface. Use this interface to communicate from the adapter to the host Activity

los.title: Parcelable
los.objectives: Encapsulate model data for transmission between Activities

los.title: Android Labs
los.objectives: Android Labs

los.title: Lab-03 Models
los.objectives: Application object + Model classes to manage placemarks.

topics.title: 05: Images
topics.objectives: A more detailed look at the fundamental types in Kotlin. How to manage images in android, including selecting and displaying images from the phone gallery.

los.title: Types
los.objectives: Summary of the basic types in the Kotlin programming language

los.title: J2K Collections
los.objectives: Collection examples: Java & Kotlin equivalents

los.title: Android Platform, Components & Activities
los.objectives: Key features of the platform, the principle components + the activity model

los.title: Resources
los.objectives: A general term for all layout, strings, bitmaps and other XML artefacts in an Android Project

los.title: Model Updates
los.objectives: Creating and updating a Placemark. Updating the placemark list.

los.title: Images
los.objectives: Support selecting image from phone gallery, and then displaying them in an activity.

los.title: Lab-04 Images
los.objectives: Allow an image to be selected from the phones photos, and stored with the placemark

topics.title: 06: Maps
topics.objectives: Review Kotlin Packages + Control flow. Introducing Google Maps into and android app.

los.title: Kotlin Packages
los.objectives: Source files start with a package declaration. This can be used to access (import) features from the source file.

los.title: Kotlin Control Flow
los.objectives: if, when, for and while statements

los.title: J2K Control Flow
los.objectives: Control flow examples in Java and Kotlin

los.title: App Structure
los.objectives: Key classes and relationships in the application.

los.title: Map Activity
los.objectives: Google Map Activity can be inserted into an app via a Wizard from Studio. API Keys must be acquired from google directly.

los.title: Cameras & Markers
los.objectives: These abstractions enable the map view to be manipulated programatically, and facilitate direct manipulation by the user.

los.title: Lab-05 MapActivity
los.objectives: Include a MapActivity, enabling the user to select the location of the placemark

topics.title: 07: Persistence
topics.objectives: Kotlin Classes in detail. New Placemark Store class to save placemarks to the file system.

los.title: Kotlin Classes I
los.objectives: Kotlin Classes I

los.title: Classes & Inheritance
los.objectives: In kotlin, classes are more concise, explicit and fine-grained then Java

los.title: J2K: Functions
los.objectives: Functions in Java & Kotlin

los.title: Persistence
los.objectives: Korlin classes & Inheritance. Storing and retrieving placemarks. JSON file serialization

los.title: File Formats
los.objectives: When a simple file persistence strategy, CSV, Name/Value, YAML, XML & JSON are all potential candidate formats for file-based storage.

los.title: JSON
los.objectives: A detailed look at the syntax of JSON

los.title: JSON Store
los.objectives: A new PlacemarkStore implementation - PlacemarkJSONStore - to persist placemarks to a JSON file.

los.title: Lab-06 JSON
los.objectives: Save and restore placemarks from a JSON formatted file

topics.title: 08: Layouts
topics.objectives: Kotlin properties, fields, & interfaces. Constraint Layout. Introduce activity to display all placemark locations + details.

los.title: Properties & Fields
los.objectives: Kotlin properties and fields offer a richer set of features and variants over Java

los.title: J2K : Classes
los.objectives: Classes in Java & Kotlin

los.title: Layouts
los.objectives: Constraint layout. Managing embedded maps. Initialisation and manipulation.

los.title: Constraint Layout
los.objectives: ConstraintLayout allows you to create large and complex layouts with a flat view

los.title: Overall Map Activity
los.objectives: Introduce an activity to display all placemarks on a single map.

los.title: Lab-07 MapView
los.objectives: Display all placemarks on a map in a new activity

los.title: Human Interface Design
los.objectives: Covers mobile design principles and practicalities. Designing with the User in Mind.
